name: Hilton Garden Inn Queens/JFK Airport

reviews.text: The hotel was very clean, very welcoming from the reception staff all the way through to the cleaners, all were professional and thats always a great sign.
reviews.title: Suitable for a stop-over...

reviews.text: Id say this hotel is more functional than anything else, in reality, if all you want to do (as I did) use the hotel as a stop over between flights then you will have no issues at all. The only problem comes if you wanted to go for a walk..there is "very" little around you (its all motorways and hotels and residential) so you might want to think about how long you will stay..for example if you are going to NYC for a weekend then here is not for you.
reviews.title: We had a very good experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Maybe one idea could be for the hotel (and others) to provide guests with 'suitable' local walks...a short cab ride away... maybe an out of town shopping mall, or a small town with bars, cafes etc..
reviews.title: Good Stay

reviews.text: As for the room, decent size, pretty much standard features..alas no UK TV channels - eg Sky News or BBC.... might be a feature for Hilton as so many Brits use JFK. Clean bathroom, very comfortable bed, with adjustments for the people that prefer soft to hard...worked really well. Room blasted out with the heater or air/con... works well.
reviews.title: Not Bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In the reception is a small lounge area, a cafe/restaurant and a nice touch..take-out coffee..on tap all day/night. Free shuttle to terminals at airport every 30 mins.
reviews.title: Worst Hotel Ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed one night and have no complaints. Very efficient shuttle service to and from JFK. Room was clean, functional, but about 10% smaller than a typical HGI. Very quiet despite being next to a major road. Did not hear any planes either.
reviews.title: Perfectly Fine JFK Hotel

reviews.text: PROS:
reviews.title: Just What I Needed

reviews.text: --lower room rates compare to Hilton JFK, Courtyard JFK, and about the same as the Fairfield Inn.
reviews.title: Un-caring hotel

reviews.text: --very friendly and courteous staff. Special thanks to Joseph (maintenance) and Natasha (desk) for their help. During breakfast in the temporary area, I was amazed at the one female server handling an entire room of guests by herself.
reviews.title: Service, Quality, Cleanliness

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: --expanded fitness center and business center since the pool was eliminated. They are about twice as big as a typical HGI.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we were snowed in at JFK for 2 nights Dec 2010 after no information given out at airport we booked into this hotel. I have to say the staff from reception to bar were warm welcoming the meals were great we were told to be at the airport at 10.00pm by the airline the hotel staff let us stay in our room as long as we wanted we were warm and very comfortable if you are ever snow stuck this place is a touch of comfort! aim glad i visited Queens on my trip to New York
reviews.title: sooooo welcoming! & confortable

reviews.text: I expected more out of Hilton Hotels. I only needed to stay one night for business the next day and chose the location due to its proximity to the airport and the time of my flights arrival.( aroun 11pm)
reviews.title: High Expectaions, Great Dissapointment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was not in the best part of town, the hotel lobby and hallways were not clean. The staff seemed uninterested in speaking with me. The room was less than desirable and did not look like it had been cleaned prior to my arrival. I was not impressed with look of the hotel, or the feeling it gave me and left in search of another location to spend the night. Quite dissapointing.
reviews.title: Good, clean, friendly hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent one night here as a stopover.
reviews.title: Convenient and nice

reviews.text: Staff were friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Convenient choice at an okay rate!

reviews.text: Ok, I had to stay overnight due to a 6AM flight this morning.
reviews.title: Great clean place to stay and park

reviews.text: I got a fantastic rate on Kayak. The staff at the front desk was VERY cheerful and VERY helpful.
reviews.title: quite the improvement!

reviews.text: I was personally introduced to the entire front desk staff. THey gave me a great rate to park my car too. Once I checked into my room the front desk called to make sure everything was perfect. The room was huge, clean and the toiletries were high class. The shuttle was only 10 min from the terminal. I will stay again.
reviews.title: We enjoyed our stay.

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel several times over the past few years and just last week noticed a marked improvement of the customer service. I truly felt like I was welcomed there, from the moment I walked in - the genuine greetings of good afternoon were shadowed by equally genuine follow up calls from room service asking about how my meal was. Bravo Hilton Garden Inn, love the new workout area too, that was in much need for improvement - the equipment all in great working order and the overall fitness room very impressive!
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.text: My girls and i just stayed here the past weekend and everything was great. We surely will stay here again.
reviews.title: Typical airport Motel

aka: Hilton Garden Inn Queens/Jfk Airport Hotel Jamaica
description: Located just a quarter mile from JFK International Airport and a short drive from the city’s top attractions, the Hilton Garden Inn Queens / JFK Airport is the perfect location for your next trip to New York City.Catch a game at Citi Field or watch the U.S. Open at the USTA Billie Jean King National Tennis Center at Flushing Meadow Park. Take a short trip to Manhattan and enjoy the great attractions the city has to offer or take the family to Coney Island. The property is also a great venue for events as well with 1200 square feet of meeting space for up to 65 guests.After a long day of sightseeing, relax on our Garden Sleep System® bed and enjoy our well-equipped rooms and when it’s time to go, we provide complimentary shuttle service to JFK airport.
